facts.fact: Tigers are the largest wild cats in the world, with males weighing up to 300 kilograms (660 pounds).
No two tigers have the same stripe pattern—it’s unique like a fingerprint.
A tiger’s roar can be heard up to 3 kilometers (1.8 miles) away.
Tigers are strong swimmers and often cool off in lakes and rivers.
Unlike most cats, tigers love water and can swim several kilometers at a time.
The Siberian tiger is the largest subspecies of tiger.
Tigers can leap more than 30 feet (9 meters) in a single bound.
A group of tigers is called a 'streak' or 'ambush,' though they are mostly solitary animals.
